comment: Excellent professor. He cares and treats you like an adult. He is not the easiest, but he is honest and fair. I wish KSU could have kept him.

He is one of the best professors that I have had at KSU, but he is fair and you can tell that he genuinely cares. I only got a “C” but I got a lot out of his course. He is moving on from KSU and he will really be missed.

Great teacher, i had him for Research Inquiry so expect a lot of reading and essays due. other than that if you put your all into his work it wont be a hard class to pass. Attendance was mandatory but his classes did not take long. there was a group project due but it was very simple.
He is absolutely one of the best professors in the department. He is very caring and quite funny, and he makes sensitive topics easy to understand.

Excellent teacher. He is funny and knows a lot about working in the field. You will not be disappointed. He makes serious discussions interesting and less threatening. He is one of the best professors I have had at KSU.
Excellent professor, brings a lot of good and personal experiences to class.
Excellent and caring. Provides a lot of good feedback. He has high expectations, but also treats you as a caring adult and student.

Excellent professor, very experienced and knowledgeable. Interesting and engaging lectures. You will have to study very hard for the tests, but everything else is not too difficult. He is very caring and understanding. You will learn so much, highly recommend taking his class!
Wonderful and caring professor. He has a lot of experience to share and gives a joke each day before we start class. He is easy to talk too.
If you do your work in the class then it will be easy! the quizzes are open note, theres two papers and a midterm which will be hard if you dont study. overall great class!
Dr. Duchac is not an easy professor, but I learned a lot from him. He has a lot of clinical experience that he shares with the class. Also, he does offer extra credit and service-learning projects.

Theres a quiz each week (no lockdown), about 3 projects, and the midterm and final exam. He was not very clear about what he expected for the projects, and instead said we could have creative freedom. However, youre given a few extra credit opportunities. We only had two absence days, after that our grade dropped a letter grade. Average Professor
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I really enjoyed Dr. Duchac's class. He brought a lot of personal experiences and is socially awkward, but funny. He has a lot of practical experience and shares this during class. Make sure you attend class. His attendance policy is no joke.

Dr. Duchac does a wonderful job teaching his courses. He has a great deal of experience and is a real leader in the class. I have taken him three times now. He expects a lot but is very caring and concerned about you as a student.

Excellent and bright professor. He expects you to come to class and participate, but he makes this very clear on the first day. He is engaging, encouraging, and there are a lot of interactive activities. I wish more of my professors were like him.

Really phenomenal professor. He is very knowledgeable and keeps the class interesting. The class is very "hands-on", there is a lot of interactive practice. Midterm was rough but he gives you a study guide. Final was a volunteer day. The only rough spot was his attendance policy. He doesn't take doctors notes and if you miss too many days you fail
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This won't be the hardest class you have to take, but he absolutely makes you put the effort in if you want to do better than a B. Very strict attendance policy, so you have to show up or get dropped by full letter grades. He's a nice guy at the end of the day, though. Learned a lot. Small quizzes + papers and exams worth a lot of points.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I just took Dr. Duchac for the second time and I really appreciated his teaching style. He is kind hearted and really understands what students are going through. He is clear in what he wants, but expects you to come to class and participate. I would take him again, if he taught more classes. He has a lot of experiences to share from the field.

I had my second class with Dr. Duchac and I think that he was one of the best professors that I have had at KSU. He is kind and really makes you think about what you are going to be doing in the future. He has a lot of experience and it is good that he shares this regularly with us. I hope that in the future, that I can have him for fieldwork.

I took Dr. Duchac this summer. He was very engaged and I learned a lot. My class was small, but he still taught the course, as if it was full. He really cares about what you learn and has a sense of humor. I highly recommend him. The tests are tough, but he gives you all the questions up front.

This class was very interesting and the professor always tried to make it fun. He let us also do practical things of giving back to the community as our midterm and final. There are know additional tests. There are reflections every week that are based off of your opinion. Very knowledgeable guy.
I enjoyed Dr. Duchac's class. He is funny and engaging. He really cares that you learn the material and that you have good practice skills. I appreciate that he has practiced in the field, too.

Professor Duchac is awesome! He is very caring and loves what he teaches! Very understanding, I would definitely take him again, I wish he taught every Human Service class here at Kennesaw! As long as you come to class you will make an A! Definitely 10/10!
